text: the number of years PhD graduates are
working as postdocs is getting longer
and longer and longer there's a problem
in that postdocs are starting to become
a substitute for real jobs during the
ACS national meeting in New Orleans
Seanie and spoke with PhDs to find out
what impact doing multiple postdocs is
having on their career growing up there
was always this idea that working in a
sim field was one of the most secure
career directions you can go into and
and I suppose that's true I have never
been unemployed for more than you know a
summer but the the quality of the
opportunities compared to even you know
10 years ago is much slower than you
would expect the system as it is right
now it leads to levels of frustration
that probably are unprecedented in the
history of science if you've done two or
three postdocs the reality is that
you're probably not going to get the
academic job that you're looking for
yeah I actually don't think you need
postdoc to get into industry so when you
see the second and third postdoc people
start to wonder I don't think that I
will take a self of stock I don't think
so I think that I will rather move out
of the scientific wall at all and get
like any kind of job I don't care if
it's chemistry related or science
related but I prefer to have something
that actually allows me to move with my
life forward when I graduated in from
undergrad in 2000 I applied for a
teaching job in a public school and they
were offering me $45,000 to start with a
bachelor's degree my current postdoc
pays $45,000 it's 13 years later at one
point you need to be realistic you know
there's your dreams of what you work for
but you need to be realistic about the
situation is that you need to find a job
and you know
because you're responsible for assembly
a lot of employers recognize that there
was an oversupply and what you're gonna
have to do is figure out how you show
that the postdocs you have made you more
valuable versus just biding your time
the only thing I can suggest is we have
to be able to figure out how to be more
nimble how to find out different kinds
of jobs where you can use some of your
expertise I don't think I'll do another
postdoc I think if you know if I don't
have you know permanent position after
this one I'll just you know open a
French restaurant then forward or
something like that even if there's
chance it could work out in the end
choosing to do multiple postdocs may
lead to more difficult decisions ahead
I'm Linda Wang for chemical and
